title: Seeing cell to cell differences for first time explains symptoms of rare genetic disorders

title_detail.value: Seeing cell to cell differences for first time explains symptoms of rare genetic disorders

summary: Every cell in the body has two genomes, one from the mother and one from the father. Until now, researchers have lacked the tools to examine -- in a single cell -the exact readout from each genome to make RNA. Using a new technology that allows researchers to do just that, an interdisciplinary team examined a rare disease in which these two genomes are expressed differently throughout the body, even sometimes in the same organ.
